; Sun, 19 Nov 2023 11:25:04 +0800 《等待戈多》作者最喜欢的戏剧来中国，观众看得很精神http://www.infzm.com/contents/260887
;;2023-11-19 10:00:00;
;

;A black box stood on the stage. "Endgame" had not officially started, but the two characters were already inside. Extremely similar clips are repeated over and over again, as if the stage has turned into a machine that plays on a loop due to malfunction. The servant Clover wrung his fingers and walked the same route repeatedly with a strange gait. He stepped back from the door to the right of Master Ham's wheelchair, walked to the corner on the left, and then to the door on the right, taking fourteen precise steps, every time.

;

;The dialogue has not changed either. "Do you want me to leave you?" "Of course." "Then I will leave you." "You can't leave me." "Then I won't leave you." The door was opened and closed again and again.

;

;In 1953, "Waiting for Godot" brought Beckett worldwide fame, but his favorite work was "Endgame" written four years later.

;

;;

;

;Beckett's play "Endgame" will be performed at the 10th Wuzhen International Theater Festival in 2023. ;(Photo courtesy of the organizer);

;

;This play shows four deformed people in an empty house that is approaching the end of the world. : The master Ham is paralyzed from the lower body, blind, and has been sitting in a wheelchair; the servant Clover has a disease in his knees and cannot sit down. Ham's parents, Nag and Nell, have lost their lower limbs and live in two trash cans. The relationships between masters and servants, husbands and wives, and parents and children all show an extremely cruel side, but they are interdependent and inseparable.

;

;In the impression of Tobias Bianconi, Director General of the International Theater Association, in the past, the audience's reaction to Beckett and even absurdist plays was sometimes "very frustrating and unhappy", but After he walked out of the theater, he found that after watching this version of the Vienna Volkstheater's performance, the Chinese audience was full of energy and had lively discussions. They all felt that the play was very fresh. "Why is there such a reaction? What is the background that makes the audience like this play so much?" he was curious.

;

;In the 20th century, which experienced the ravages of two world wars and was immersed in industrialization and the post-industrial era, the rationalism admired by Western civilization fell into crisis, belief in God collapsed, and self-doubt and self-denial became the themes of the times. This also brought profound conceptual changes to drama. What Beckett's drama expresses is the antagonistic relationship between human beings and nature, society, self and others who are completely alienated in social crisis.

;

;Absurd drama, which was born in Paris, France, in the early 1950s, was echoed again in Wuzhen, China, seventy years later. "At the beginning, we thought the most exciting thing was this very unhealthy and toxic relationship. Later we discovered that it had some parts related to war. As it slowly developed, we found that it might be related to climate change. Recently, We found that it was combined with the COVID-19 epidemic." During the dialogue, theater director and German director Kai Vogels said that this version of "Endgame" has been performed for eleven years. "The point of it being constantly performed is that it is always new. , what we see from this drama keeps changing."

;

;;

;

;Beckett's play "Endgame" was written in the late 1950s. The version that came to China has already been sold in Europe Acted for eleven years. ;(Photo courtesy of the organizer);

;

;Vogels refined the four characters into two clown-like people, retaining the main theme A very tense contrast between servants: Ham is physically disabled, but has the power to control Clover; Clough is relatively able to move freely, but is always dominated by his master to do unnecessary trivial things, and his spirit tends to be paralyzed. .

;

;The most eye-catching adaptation is Vogels’ emphasis on the sense of looping. The line, which was on an infinite loop before the show even started, only appeared once in the original script. Vogels uses this as the opening or closing line of every dialogue, repeating it a dozen times throughout the play.

;

;A new plot in the play brings an "anti-climax": after Clover struggled, he shot Hamm, but the expected relief brought by death did not happen. After the monologue, Ham suddenly answered and got up from the ground, as if nothing had happened. Clover and he returned to their usual endless conversation.

;

;"Beckett actually demonstrated a ritual cycle on the stage. The ending of this ritual cycle is satisfaction, nothingness, or the end of the world. Everyone can see it differently. Each point has its own interpretation, and what I present on the stage also has this meaning." At the beginning of the rehearsal, Vogels hoped to show the inextricable cycle of repetition on the stage without making the audience feel bored. This balance Feeling is what he is looking for.

;

;Since 1998 Vogels has been a theater and opera director in Austria and Germany. German theater is relatively lagging behind in digital innovation. From 2010 to 2020, while serving as the artistic director of the Dortmund Theater in Germany, Vogels began to try to combine digital media with theater and introduce digital thinking to the theater stage. He is a pioneer.

;

;Among these works, digital techniques such as VR, real-time imaging, and on-site editing are emerging in endlessly. "Endgame" pursues Beckett's minimalist style. However, the artificially isolated cramped space, heavy metal-style amplified sound effects, The sudden switching of dazzling lights, the characters' mechanically looping movements and lines, all give this picture of the human spiritual wasteland a cold science fiction color.

;

;The more traditional images such as "desert" and "dead branches" in Beckett's original work are missing. In terms of stage design, the play chose a form that abstracted away from reality. Like the door, the few sets and props are all outlined with white chalk lines. Three-dimensional life seems to be locked in two-dimensional space. Machine guns and toy dogs are just thin wooden boards hanging on the wall when they are not picked out by actors and held in their hands. The clock has no hands and the flowers in the vase are out of proportion. The only two real objects are the wooden chair with armrests in the center of the stage and the light bulb hanging in the air.

;

;The actors' performances are consistent with German precision, and they achieve the ultimate in repetitive movements with slight changes. The actor who played Ham sat in a chair with his eyes closed throughout the performance, but still showed a strong sense of dominance and oppression in the relationship through his tone and gestures.

;

;The voice can be called the third "starring" of this drama, expanding the information and emotional density in the minimalist world. Clough's footsteps continued to echo in the space, powerful, but as flat as the scenery, with no specific sense of direction. Footsteps create a strong conflict with directionlessness. Every time Clover dropped something he was holding, there was a loud cracking sound, whether it was a telescope, a machine gun, or a toy dog. The laws of the physical world break down here.

;

;The two people, who are both master and servant and father and son, are imprisoned in a lifeless atmosphere. The room they were in was, in a sense, like the final game board in a chess game. Ham is the general on the chessboard and needs to ensure that he is in the "center" of the room, controlling his pieces. The little soldier Clover could barely move a few steps, but under the command of blind Ham, the situation was certain to lose, but they could not and did not dare to leave the room, just like the chess pieces could not leave the chessboard. "There is no nature anymore" outside the house. Even when I opened the window, I saw "ZERO" written on the blackboard.

;

;They passed the time by teasing, controlling, and torturing each other, telling the old stories again, and looking at the window that they had looked at countless times, hoping that something would happen. What happened in front of my eyes was that other people passed by the window. However, their expectations were all in vain, and all their actions no longer made much sense.

;

;At the end of the play, I realized that the beginning was the end. "What time is it?" "Same as usual." They repeated the dialogue at the opening. Everything stopped suddenly, leaving silence and darkness.

; Sun, 19 Nov 2023 10:25:04 +0800 冒充专家行医十年，靠秘方自制抗癌药：无证“神医”的罪与罚http://www.infzm.com/contents/260877
;;2023-11-19 08:59:00;
;

;;

;

;"Miracle doctors" sell a bunch of titles to their patients. Nongjian Illustration

;

;Qingdao’s “old Chinese medicine doctor” Hou Yuanxiang, who pretended to be an expert and professor and practiced medicine illegally for more than ten years, fell for his homemade “anti-cancer drug” - in February 2023, Hou Yuanxiang was arrested by Qingdao at first instance The Huangdao District People's Court of the city sentenced him to 12 years in prison and fined him 12 million yuan for "producing and selling counterfeit drugs."

;

;Like Hou Yuanxiang, his daughter, son, wife and former son-in-law were also sentenced for "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" and were sentenced to prison terms ranging from 11 to 3 years respectively. In addition, the son of Hou Yuanxiang's third sister was also involved in the case. He was sentenced to 11 years in prison for "fraud" and "harboring" in the first instance.

;

;The total prison term for the above six people is 50 years, and the total fine is 29.8 million yuan. Southern Weekend reporters searched online for judgment documents and found that among counterfeit drug cases in recent years, the first-instance verdict in Hou Yuanxiang's case was extremely rare in terms of heavy sentencing and high fines.

;

;However, the case has not yet been settled. After the first-instance verdict, as Hou Yuanxiang and others filed an appeal, many self-media appeared on the Internet to "cry out injustice" for them. Some associated the case with the "folk traditional Chinese medicine" group, believing that "if this lawsuit is lost, almost all folk Chinese medicine practitioners must close their doors." (For details, please see the report ;"The Online Public Opinion War on the "Miracle Cancer Doctor";)

;

;Hou Yuanxiang's agent The lawyer questioned the characterization of the drugs involved in the case, arguing that after the revision of the Drug Administration Law in 2019, the threshold for identification of counterfeit drugs has been raised. Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine is made of traditional Chinese medicinal materials and should not be identified as counterfeit drugs. Hou Yuanxiang does not constitute “production.” , the crime of selling counterfeit medicines."

;

;On August 30, 2023, the Qingdao Intermediate People’s Court ruled to revoke the original judgment and remand the case for retrial on the grounds that the first-instance judgment “had unclear facts and insufficient evidence.”

;

;The "old Chinese doctor" who can't take the pulse

;

;After being criminally detained on February 17, 2022, Hou Yuanxiang only stayed in the detention center for more than 20 days. After that, the police changed the enforcement measures to "residential surveillance" because of his illness.

;

;Li Gang, the second-instance attorney, met Hou Yuanxiang after the National Day in 2023. According to him, two policemen worked in three shifts, watching him 24 hours a day, "maybe because there are more patients coming to him."

;

;According to the first-instance verdict, 66-year-old Hou Yuanxiang is from Shandong A native of Yishui County, Linyi City, the province, he once worked as a teacher in the county, but later took a leave of absence without pay and became a doctor. After that, he moved his family to Weifang and settled down. Around 2019, after purchasing real estate in Qingdao, Hou Yuanxiang and his wife and their daughter Hou Jing and his wife both moved their household registrations to Qingdao.

;

;Hou Yuanxiang’s confession cited in the first-instance verdict did not explain his medical experience. Some self-media said that Hou Yuanxiang studied under two "famous Chinese medicine doctors" Zhang Moumou and Lou Moumou, but Southern Weekend reporters did not find any information about the latter two as "famous Chinese medicine doctors".

;

;However, it is certain that Hou Yuanxiang is not from a "family of traditional Chinese medicine" or "six generations practicing medicine" as some self-media said.

;

;According to what Hou Yuanxiang’s wife and sister told China News Weekly, Hou Yuanxiang was originally a primary school teacher and started studying medicine when he was about 40 years old. He had “several teachers” but “all of them are gone.” This relative emphasized that Hou Yuanxiang was "excellent" in taking his pulse - he could tell whether it was cancer or what kind of cancer it was by just touching it.

;

;As a daughter-in-law, Li Jianying told Southern Weekend reporters that she did not know how Hou Yuanxiang learned Chinese medicine.

;

;Most patients call Hou Yuanxiang "Professor Hou", and Hou Yuanxiang's WeChat signature is also "Professor Hou". The "Central Health" website, which claims to provide communication, display, and promotion services for "folk doctors," still has Hou Yuanxiang's personal introduction, calling him an "international doctor of medicine" and "an authoritative international cancer expert."

;

;However, according to Hou Yuanxiang’s confession, his online profiles, including “Professor of Chinese Medical College” and “Doctor of International Medicine”, “are all false” and “are intended to expand influence and make patients believe I".

;

;In fact, Hou Yuanxiang did not even obtain a medical practicing certificate. Since the implementation of the Practicing Physician Law in 1999, regardless of whether it is traditional Chinese medicine or Western medicine, all practitioners must have a physician's practice certificate. Otherwise, it will be regarded as "illegal practice of medicine", and they will be subject to administrative penalties in the lightest case and criminal liability in the worst case.

;

;A patient surnamed Xu testified that she began to seek medical treatment from Hou Yuanxiang in 2014. Since then, she has introduced many patients to Hou, and also asked Hou to attend a consultation at his winery. In 2019, she and Hou Yuanxiang co-organized When he went to the hospital, he found that Hou could not produce his medical license, so he doubted his identity.

;

;Not only patients, but also some senior medical professionals had no doubts about Hou Yuanxiang's identity and ability. According to the first-instance verdict, Hou Yuanxiang had been a doctor at Deyi Hall, a private traditional Chinese medicine hospital in Qingdao for a long time. Later, the person in charge of Deyi Hall asked Hou Yuanxiang to attach his medical qualification to the hospital. However, Hou Yuanxiang refused, and the two parties terminated the cooperation.

;

;According to the testimony of Shen Yufa, director of Zibo Yiyuan Ruikang Hospital, around 2010, he met Hou Yuanxiang at a medical academic conference in Beijing. “Many people attending the conference at that time said that Professor Hou was a doctor of traditional Chinese medicine. He is famous for tumors, cancer, and cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases."

;

;Later, Shen Yufa’s wife got cancer and took Hou Yuanxiang’s homemade medicine. Shen Yufa also hired Hou as a "part-time professor" at Ruikang Hospital and sold Hou's medicine at the hospital.

;

;According to Hou Yuanxiang’s confession, Shen Yufa once invited him to sit in Ruikang Hospital, but he refused because he did not have a medical license. The two parties only cooperated on selling medicines. However, Shen Yufa's son and another employee of the hospital confirmed that Hou Yuanxiang did not attend the hospital regularly.

;

;In addition to private hospitals, Hou Yuanxiang has also worked with public hospitals. In 2016, Weifang Municipal Government Hospital, a public hospital, posted on its WeChat official account that Hou Yuanxiang was an "authoritative expert in international cancer research" and would conduct monthly consultations at the branch of traditional Chinese medicine. This article disappeared only recently.

;

;Patients trust Hou Yuanxiang not only because of his impressive online resume, but also because of his “accurate” pulse numbering.

;

;Dong Shijie is a relative of Hou Yuanxiang, a Jilin patient. According to him, Hou Yuanxiang once traveled to Changbai Mountain and hosted meals by himself. Hou Yuanxiang took his pulse on the spot. "I have a friend who has high blood lipids and high blood pressure, and he can detect it," Dong Shijie told a reporter from Southern Weekend.

;

;However, according to the first-instance verdict, Hou Yuanxiang admitted to the investigators that he actually could not take a pulse. The reason for pretending to know the pulse is "to put it bluntly, it is to let the patient buy medicine."

;

;When he learned that Hou Yuanxiang could not check the pulse, Dong Shijie was shocked: "He is a traditional Chinese medicine doctor. What kind of disease would he treat if he could not check the pulse?"

;

;"The whole family went into hiding" after the incident

;

;According to the first-instance judgment, since 2011, Hou Yuanxiang, Hou Jing and others, without obtaining a drug production license, a drug business license, etc., posted Hou Yuanxiang’s false personal profile on the Internet to spread information in many places in Shandong Consulting and selling drugs claiming to be anti-cancer.

;

;In Hou Yuanxiang’s counterfeit drug case, the first person to be involved was his daughter Hou Jing—like her father, she did not have a medical certificate. On January 16, 2022, after receiving complaints and reports, multiple departments in Huangdao District, Qingdao City jointly conducted law enforcement and captured Hou Jing on the spot. Later, Hou Jing confessed to Hou Yuanxiang, his brother Hou Lei and others.

;

;According to the first-instance verdict, Hou Yuanxiang was at his home in Weifang at the time. He didn’t seem to care at first. It wasn’t until Hou Jing was detained and he was interrogated by the police that he realized the seriousness of the situation and transferred the self-made medicine to Qingdao Clinic overnight. and production tools, but it was too late.

;

;The court of first instance found that after Hou Jing was detained, Hou Yuanxiang's wife went to the police station handling the case to inquire about information, and "hidden the whole family" after returning home for an excuse. The police then pursued the Hou family online.

;

;According to Hou Lei’s confession, Hou Yuanxiang called him the day after Hou Jing was arrested. "Two or three days later, my father said that this was a serious matter and asked me not to use my current mobile phone and to go out and hide. After hanging up the phone, I took out the phone card and threw it in the trash."

;

;As for how Hou Lei participated in these businesses, Hou Lei said that in the winter of 2019, Hou Yuanxiang "asked me to apply for a bank card in the name of my wife Li Jianying... and asked me to pretend Director Li of the hospital, if a patient wants to buy medicine, call me and ask me to give the patient a bank card so that the patient can transfer money."

;

;According to Hou Yuanxiang’s confession, Hou Jing and Hou Lei had a bad relationship. After Hou Lei knew that Hou Jing was making money, he also wanted to sell medicine with his father. He asked him for the formula many times, but Hou Yuanxiang did not give it. He just asked Hou Lei to follow him and pay him a salary.

;

;Li Jianying told Southern Weekend reporters that Hou Lei helped Hou Yuanxiang deliver goods in Weifang, "equivalent to a courier." In the first-instance verdict, Hou Lei was sentenced to "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" according to law, and was sentenced to 8 years in prison and fined 5 million yuan.

;

;According to Hou Lei's confession, after hiding for a few days, he received a call from Hou Yuanxiang from an unknown number, suggesting that he go to the third aunt's house in Qingdao to celebrate the New Year, and then the whole family went to the third aunt's house. According to Hou Lei's confession, because he felt that "the matter was quite serious", he once suggested that his father surrender. "My father was very angry and said that I was not his biological child."

;

;Li Shuai, the son of Hou Lei’s third aunt, told Hou Lei that he had the connections to settle the matter, but he would need 4 million yuan. After several communications, Hou Lei asked his ex-brother-in-law Fu Songjie to send 2 million yuan in cash to Li Shuai after he had already paid 500,000 yuan. Li Shuai confessed that when he saw Fu Songjie coming to the door with a sack of money, he was stunned: "This is the first time I have seen so much money."

;

;Fu Songjie was originally from a district in Weifang City In 2019, he resigned and went to Qingdao at the request of his ex-wife Hou Jing. Before resigning, Hou Yuanxiang approached him and asked him to serve as the legal representative of a private hospital in which Hou was a shareholder. After Fu Songjie arrived in Qingdao, he caught up with the epidemic and had no job, so he helped his father-in-law and his ex-wife, and ended up becoming an accomplice. Fu Songjie was sentenced to 3 years in prison and fined 500,000 yuan in the first instance. The sentence was the shortest among all those involved in the case, and Fu was the only one who did not appeal.

;

;After Hou Lei was arrested, he confessed Li Shuai. In the next three days, Li Shuai, Fu Songjie and Hou Yuanxiang were arrested one after another.

;

;According to Hou Yuanxiang, in addition to the above 2.5 million yuan, Li Shuai also defrauded him of more than 2 million yuan. The first-instance judgment confirmed the matter and stated that "it will be separately investigated and handled by the public security organs."

;

;In the Hou Yuanxiang counterfeit drug case, the police seized a total of 8 houses in the Hou family.

;

;In late February 2022, a week after Hou Yuanxiang was arrested, the Ministry of Public Security announced the first batch of eight major typical drug crime cases to be supervised, and Hou Yuanxiang’s fake drug case was among them.

;

;"Secret Recipes" of Unknown Origin

;

;In the Hou Yuanxiang case, the medicines that were classified as fake were four self-made medicines by Hou Yuanxiang and his daughter, two of which were named " Anti-Cancer No. 1” and “Anti-Cancer No. 2”. According to Hou Yuanxiang's confession, these two medicines were made according to a "secret recipe."

;

;However, Hou Yuanxiang has different opinions on the origin of this "secret recipe". During the investigation stage of the case, he said that the secret recipe came from one of his "second grandfathers." This recipe originally contained five kinds of medicine. On this basis, Hou Yuanxiang added shiitake mushrooms, ganoderma lucidum, and cordyceps. "Even if this recipe is my own creation, I I have always wanted to promote this prescription and sell the medicine to make money."

;

;However, during the trial stage of the case, Hou Yuanxiang’s statement about the “secret recipe” changed—he claimed that the recipe was given to him by his “teacher” at the end of 2019.

;

;Hou Yuanxiang’s different statements about the source of the secret recipe puzzled a second-instance attorney: “Perhaps only he himself knows the truth.”

;

;The first-instance judgment quoted an attorney of the Hou family According to the lawyer, Hou Yuanxiang's anti-cancer "secret recipe" contains many Chinese medicinal materials such as shiitake mushrooms, cordyceps, Ganoderma lucidum, Prunella vulgaris, black dates, kelp, burdock root, dandelion root, ginseng, astragalus, angelica and so on.

;

;A Chinese medicine practitioner who has been practicing for more than 40 years told Southern Weekend reporters that the Chinese medicinal materials in Hou Yuanxiang’s prescription include both “tonifying” and “attacking” ingredients, such as ginseng, Astragalus, when cancer patients reach the middle and late stages, most of them are relatively weak, so it is beneficial to use some tonics; "attack" medicines such as kelp, which has the effect of clearing away heat and dissipating stagnation, is only suitable for some early-stage cancer patients and is not suitable for late-stage cancer patients.

;

;Among Hou Yuanxiang’s patients, there are many terminal cancer patients, and some came to Hou Yuanxiang because they were “sentenced to death by the hospital.”

;

;Different from traditional Chinese medicine (TCM), which treats patients according to prescriptions, Hou Yuanxiang’s anti-cancer drugs are prepared in advance, bagged and then sold to patients. According to his confession, around November 2020, Hou Jing purchased a decoction-making machine online. Since then, the father and daughter have taken turns using this machine to make decoctions, "and can make about 80 bags a day."

;

;The price of "Anti-cancer No. 1" is 4,620 yuan per serving, and "Anti-cancer No. 2" is 1,920 yuan. One dose is taken for one course of treatment, and one course of treatment lasts for 12 days.

;

;As for Hou Yuanxiang’s homemade anti-cancer drugs, Zhao Yin, a lawyer who graduated from the University of Traditional Chinese Medicine and has worked in the clinical department of traditional Chinese medicine in the hospital for many years, believes that it is definitely illegal. According to her, Hou Yuanxiang's self-made medicines are similar to "medical institution (TCM) preparations" in hospitals, which refer to fixed prescription preparations prepared by medical institutions for their own use after approval based on the clinical needs of the unit. However, hospital preparations, like medicines, generally need to be approved by the drug regulatory department before they can be produced and sold. In principle, they can only be produced by the hospital for their own use and cannot be sold externally.

;

;Zhao Yin said that after the promulgation of the Traditional Chinese Medicine Law in 2017, the state has relaxed its management of traditional Chinese medicine preparations. Traditional Chinese medicine preparations that only use traditional techniques do not need to obtain a preparation approval number and only need to apply for a preparation approval number. It can be prepared after registration with the provincial drug regulatory department.

;

;However, Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine has also not been registered.

;

;The Traditional Chinese Medicine Law stipulates that medical institutions that prepare traditional Chinese medicine preparations that should be registered but fail to do so will be punished as producing counterfeit drugs.

;

;Zhao Yin also doubted whether Hou Yuanxiang’s homemade anti-cancer medicine really contained a sufficient amount of Chinese medicinal materials such as cordyceps claimed in the “secret recipe” because the medicine was made by Hou Yuanxiang and his daughter themselves and there was no formula. The production process standards lack proper supervision and supervision. However, quantitative detection of Cordyceps sinensis is very difficult.

;

;According to Fu Songjie’s confession, Hou Jing would send Liuwei Dihuang Pills and other Chinese patent medicines to patients together with the boiled Chinese medicine liquid. In Zhao Yin's view, in this way, even if the patient feels effective after taking the medicine, it may be the effect of the proprietary Chinese medicine.

;

;In order to avoid the characterization of "fake medicine", Hou Yuanxiang once tried to defend himself by claiming that "medicine and food have the same origin", which means that what he sells is food. However, due to the labeling of drug names such as "Anti-cancer No. 1" and "Anti-cancer No. 2", his defense is difficult to establish.

;

;Zhao Yin believes that the drug names "Anti-cancer No. 1" and "Anti-cancer No. 2" are nondescript, because cancer is a concept of Western medicine, and traditional Chinese medicine generally does not have the term "cancer" or "tumor". Instead, it is called "accumulation of symptoms."

;

;As for Hou Yuanxiang’s practice of making homemade anti-cancer drugs, the above-mentioned traditional Chinese medicine doctors interviewed by Southern Weekend reporters called him “too courageous”. In his opinion, many Chinese medicine practitioners have secret recipes. In order not to reveal the secret recipes, they usually only sell the medicinal materials to patients. At most, they cook them for the patients. They certainly dare not make their own medicines and sell them to patients.

;

;Have any cancer patients been cured?

;

;However, supporters "voted injustice" against Hou Yuanxiang on the Internet because he cured many cancer patients. However, a Southern Weekend reporter's investigation found that it is questionable whether any cancer patients were actually cured by Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;After the first-instance verdict of the Hou Yuanxiang case, a list of cancer patients who claimed to be "cured by Hou Yuanxiang" leaked online. There were a total of 31 personal information of patients or patients' family members on the list. This list is consistent with that provided to Southern Weekend reporters by Gong Feiyun, one of Hou Yuanxiang’s supporters. According to Gong Feiyun, at the end of June 2023, he went to Qingdao to meet Hou Yuanxiang, and it was Hou Yuanxiang himself who gave him this list. Gong Feiyun is a partner of a local traditional Chinese medicine clinic. A few years ago, he was involved in a controversy when self-made medicines were deemed to be counterfeit.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters made all 31 calls on the list, of which 11 were not answered and 13 were refused. Of the 7 calls answered, 6 admitted that they were patients on the list or Family members, and another person denied that he was Che Moumou, the "Director of the Provincial Environmental Protection Bureau" written on the list, saying that he was "running business."

;

;Among the 6 people, 3 people refused to be interviewed on the grounds of "something happened" and "privacy involved", and only 3 people accepted the telephone interview.

;

;The patient, Song Yuanjia, is from Qingdao, Shandong. He claimed that he was "sentenced to death by the hospital." He approached Hou Yuanxiang with the mentality of giving it a try, and "it was fine once he tried it." "It has been 7 years now. Nothing".

;

;Song Yuan’s family told Southern Weekend reporters that Hou Yuanxiang’s medicine was an “ancestral medicine” and he spent more than 200,000 yuan without giving a prescription, first taking “Anti-Cancer No. 1” and “in the end he became poor. Feel better, take 'Anti-Cancer No. 2'".

;

;According to the first-instance verdict, when Hou Yuanxiang moved his homemade medicine and production tools overnight, he asked the Song Yuan family for help, and the Song Yuan family found a warehouse for him to store the items Hou Yuanxiang moved.

;

;Song Yuanjia told Southern Weekend reporters that he had read Hou Yuanxiang’s first-instance verdict, but he was more willing to believe the “crying out injustice” video on the self-media.

;

;Another interviewee, Wang Jingjiang, is a villager in a village in Zibo, Shandong, and the patient is his mother-in-law. He said that Hou Yuanxiang once planned to build a sanatorium in the village. He was driving for the village party secretary and got to know Hou. Later, his mother-in-law got cancer and there was no possibility of surgery. After undergoing chemotherapy for a period of time, he contacted "Professor Hou".

;

;Wang Jingjiang said that Hou Yuanxiang's medicine was "good" and his mother-in-law felt "strong" after drinking it. However, she stopped drinking it because she couldn't stand the taste.

;

;In the opinion of lawyer Yang Fengzhu, one of the experts in drafting and demonstrating traditional Chinese medicine laws, Hou Yuanxiang’s “anti-cancer drugs” are several Chinese medicines mixed together. Although Chinese medicine treatments rarely have “immediate results”, they are not It has no effect. "Once you take the (Chinese medicine) that replenishes qi, it will definitely have an effect."

;

;Wang Jingjiang also emphasized that his mother-in-law was not "cured", but "has not (re) committed the crime or been transferred."

;

;The third interviewee, Li Cheng (pseudonym), is from Yanbian, Jilin. He told Southern Weekend reporters that the patient was his grandfather, and he had indeed seen Hou Yuanxiang for medical treatment and taken his homemade medicine. The old man passed away in September 2022.

;

;Li Cheng said that his grandfather was diagnosed with rectal cancer in July 2019 and had spread to the lymph nodes. Relatives introduced him to Hou Yuanxiang. He has never met Hou Yuanxiang so far, and the two mainly communicate through WeChat. He said that after adding WeChat, Hou Yuanxiang once sent his personal profile, "I also searched on Baidu about world cancer, committees, and cancer treatment experts, and I could indeed find this person. I thought this person was quite good." sharp".

;

;When receiving a call from a Southern Weekend reporter, Li Cheng still called Hou Yuanxiang "Professor Hou." When he learned that Hou Yuanxiang was not a professor and did not even have a medical license, he was surprised and said that if he had known about this situation, he would "definitely consider" whether to seek medical treatment from Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;Li Cheng said that in addition to drinking Hou Yuanxiang’s anti-cancer drugs, his grandfather also ate the “nutritious meals” recommended by Hou Yuanxiang. "After about three courses of treatment, (grandpa) recovered very well." Li Cheng said, for this reason, he also introduced many patients to Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;However, Li Cheng could not confirm whether his grandfather's condition improved for a time. "Whether Professor Hou's medicine played a greater role or my grandfather's personal mentality played a greater role." Li Cheng said, "We all say that (Hou Yuanxiang's medicine) is effective and easy to use, and it may have played a supporting role in grandpa's mental state."

;

;Yang Fengzhu has participated in many clinical trial demonstrations of drugs. . In his opinion, when patients undergo treatment, "psychological effects are very important and can affect 30% of the (treatment) effect."

;

;Li Cheng also said that while his grandfather was taking Hou Yuanxiang's medicine, he also underwent other treatments, including surgery, and "Chinese and Western medicine worked simultaneously."

;

;After "slimming down" with fake medicine

;

;Neither the attorney nor Hou Yuanxiang himself expected that the first instance would impose such a severe sentence.

;

;However, according to relevant legal provisions and the amount of money involved ascertained by the driver’s agency, once Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine is deemed to be counterfeit, the sentence will not be lenient.

;

;During the first trial, many attorneys representing the Hou family argued that Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine did not cause any harm to the patient. Hou Yuanxiang himself also stated that "children can drink" his medicine.

;

;However, the lack of any harm does not mean that Hou Yuanxiang does not commit the crime of "producing and selling counterfeit drugs", nor does it mean that he cannot be severely sentenced.

;

;According to the criminal law before the 2011 revision, the crime of "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" requires "serious harm to human health" and causing death or serious injury in order to be sentenced to more than ten years in prison.

;

;Zhao Yin said that in order to increase the crackdown on counterfeit drugs, the Eighth Amendment to the Criminal Law in 2011 amended the "crime of producing and selling counterfeit drugs" and no longer included "seriously endangering human health". "As a threshold for criminalization, as long as the production and sale of counterfeit medicines constitutes a crime.

;

;At the same time, the Eighth Amendment to the Criminal Law no longer requires death or serious injury as the only condition for a heavy sentence. It stipulates that "other particularly serious circumstances" can also be harshly sentenced. In 2014, the Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuratorate issued a judicial interpretation that as long as the production and sale of counterfeit drugs reaches 500,000 yuan, it constitutes "other particularly serious circumstances" under the Eighth Amendment to the Criminal Law.

;

;The first-instance court determined that Hou Yuanxiang’s production and sales of counterfeit drugs amounted to more than 14.36 million yuan, far exceeding 500,000 yuan. This means that once Hou Yuanxiang’s homemade medicine is determined to be counterfeit, he will be sentenced to more than ten years in prison.

;

;Whether Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine can be identified as counterfeit medicine must be based on the Drug Administration Law. Zhao Yin believes that before the law was revised in 2019, the identification of counterfeit drugs was relatively simple - as long as the drug did not obtain a batch number, it would be "treated as a counterfeit drug", thus constituting a counterfeit drug in the sense of criminal law.

;

;However, the Drug Administration Law revised in 2019 has made major changes to the definition of counterfeit drugs. Drugs without batch numbers are no longer automatically treated as counterfeit drugs.

;

;The industry generally believes that the above-mentioned modifications to the Drug Administration Law are related to the Hunan Lu Yong case. Lu Yong, a leukemia patient, purchased generic drugs from informal channels and helped his patients purchase the drugs. In 2018, the movie "I'm Not the God of Medicine" based on it was released, triggering widespread public discussion on China's drug management system.

;

;The revised Drug Administration Law stipulates that counterfeit drugs can be classified as counterfeit drugs only under four circumstances (see the information link at the end of the article for details).

;

;According to Cao Guoying, director of the Beijing Changjiang Pharmaceutical Development Foundation, who has long been engaged in anti-counterfeiting practice and research on drugs, after the revision of the Drug Administration Law, the number of counterfeit drug cases handled by the drug regulatory department showed a "cliff-like decline."

;

;According to data from the website of the State Food and Drug Administration, in 2019, the number of counterfeit drug cases investigated and dealt with by drug regulatory departments across the country was 14,041. In the following year after the revision of the Drug Administration Law, the number of such cases There were only 7,361 cases, a decrease of nearly half.

;

;A reporter from Southern Weekend searched the Judgment Documents Network using the keyword "counterfeit drugs" and found that based on the revision of the Drug Administration Law, the number of judgments in criminal cases of counterfeit drugs dropped sharply from 5,044 in 2019 to 2020. Of the 2,361 pieces, more than half were missing. There was also a downward trend in the following years.

;

;The 2019 version of the Drug Administration Law has significantly increased fines while "slimming down" counterfeit drugs. "The starting point of the fine is 15 times the production and sales amount, and if it is less than 100,000, it will be calculated as 100,000." Zhao Yin said, "As long as you are producing and selling counterfeit drugs, you will be fined at least 1.5 million, and you will be punished to death (for production, sales, etc.) Selling counterfeit medicines)."

;

;Are Chinese medicinal materials medicines?

;

;In Cao Guoying's view, under the current overall environment of drug counterfeiting, it is "very difficult" for Qingdao to investigate the Hou Yuanxiang case.

;

;However, whether Hou Yuanxiang should be held criminally responsible for "producing and selling counterfeit drugs" has caused controversy in both the legal and traditional Chinese medicine circles.

;

;The Hou family’s attorney cited the revised Drug Administration Law in 2019 as an excuse to believe that Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine is made from traditional Chinese medicinal materials and should not be regarded as counterfeit medicine. Hou Yuanxiang and others do not constitute “production.” , the crime of selling counterfeit medicines."

;

;In fact, according to the first-instance judgment of Hou Yuanxiang’s case, the public security organs initially opened a case against Hou Yuanxiang and others for “illegal business operations.”

;

;One month after the case was filed, the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau issued a counterfeit drug identification certificate, identifying Hou Yuanxiang’s four self-made medicines as counterfeit drugs. According to the relevant judicial interpretations issued by the Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuratorate in 2014, if it is difficult to determine "fake drugs" or "inferior drugs", the judicial authorities can make determinations based on the identification opinions issued by the drug regulatory authorities at or above the prefectural or municipal level.

;

;According to the above-mentioned certification, Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made "Anti-cancer No. 1" and "Anti-cancer No. 2", "Liver" which claims to treat liver cancer, and "Wild Heart and Brain Decoction" used to treat heart disease The medicine was deemed to be counterfeit.

;

;After the case entered the review and prosecution stage, at the request of the Huangdao District People’s Procuratorate, the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau issued a supplementary explanation explaining why the product involved in the case was identified as a counterfeit drug.

;

;The description pointed out that Hou Yuanxiang’s four self-made products “have no drug registration certificate number, no medical institution preparation record, no drug production license, no medical institution preparation license, no national standards, etc., but they are produced Drugs promoted for the treatment of cancer, liver cancer, cardiovascular and cerebrovascular diseases, etc. were sold to patients for treatment. The products involved were non-drugs. Everyone agreed that the above four involved products met the definition of drugs in the newly revised Drug Law...";

;A lawyer representing the second instance pointed out that on the one hand, the above discussion said that the product involved in the case "conforms to the definition of a drug", on the other hand, it also said that it was a "non-drug". In his opinion, the reason why the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau made such a statement is because according to the new drug management law, "the only thing that can be caught is this one (non-drugs counterfeiting drugs)".

;

; Regarding the issue of identifying counterfeit drugs produced by Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine, Southern Weekend reporters contacted the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau. The bureau refused to interview because Hou Yuanxiang’s case was under trial.

;

;During the first trial, almost all the lawyers representing the Hou family questioned the determination of counterfeit drugs in the case. One of the lawyers pointed out that most of the medicinal materials used in "Anti-cancer No. 1" and "Anti-cancer No. 2" are in the 2020 edition of the "Chinese Pharmacopoeia", which does not qualify as "passing off drugs as non-drugs."

;

;However, in Zhao Yin's view, Chinese herbal medicines are not necessarily considered medicines - Chinese herbal medicines are only raw materials for making medicines and can be sold in the medicinal materials market, but the medicines must have a pharmaceutical business license. Sale.

;

;Where did Hou Yuanxiang and his daughter buy the medicinal materials used in their homemade medicine? There was no explanation in the relevant confession cited in the first-instance judgment, and Hou Jing was unable to provide the purchase notes and legal supporting documents. According to the confession of Hou Jing's ex-husband Fu Songjie, the herbs Hou Jing purchased were sent via express delivery and logistics, and the consignees usually used pseudonyms.

;

;Li Gang, the attorney for the second instance, questioned the identification of counterfeit drugs on which the first-instance judgment was based on the grounds that the identification of counterfeit drugs involved in the case had not been inspected by the provincial drug regulatory department.

;

;According to the new judicial interpretation issued by the Supreme People's Court and the Supreme People's Procuratorate in 2022 (the old judicial interpretation in 2014 will be abolished after it takes effect), for the situation of "non-drugs passing off as drugs", only when there is no dispute Only then can the municipal drug regulatory department directly identify the drug as counterfeit. If there is any dispute, it must be inspected by a drug inspection agency set up or determined by the drug regulatory department at or above the provincial level.

;

;In Li Gang’s view, the identification of counterfeit drugs involved in Hou Yuanxiang’s case is obviously controversial and should be tested. However, he believes that folk traditional Chinese medicine prescriptions lack national standards, and even if the results are tested, they lack scientificity and legality. Moreover, Hou Yuanxiang’s medicine was not tested at the time, and it has been detained for more than a year now. “It has already spoiled, how can it be tested?”

;

;On November 5, 2023, another lawyer representing Hou Yuanxiang told Southern Weekend reporters, After the case was remanded for retrial, the procuratorate added a lot of evidence to the court, including an inspection report on Hou Yuanxiang's self-made medicine. According to this inspection report, Western medicine ingredients used to treat diabetes were detected in Hou Yuanxiang’s self-made medicine. Based on this, the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau still determined that the product involved was a counterfeit medicine.

;

;The above-mentioned attorney Hou Yuanxiang said that this shows that the drug regulatory department may no longer identify the products involved as counterfeit drugs according to the "non-drug counterfeit drugs".

;

;As for the crimes involved in Hou Yuanxiang, Yang Zhiwei, a lawyer at Guangdong Faquan Law Firm, put forward another point of view to Southern Weekend reporters: If Hou Yuanxiang’s "Anti-Cancer No. 1" and "Anti-Cancer No. 2" are clearly related to the treatment of cancer "There is no boundary." Hou Yuanxiang's purpose is to sell drugs to make money, so he may be guilty of fraud.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters found such a case on the Judgment Documents Online: In 2019, Li Mouxiang, who had no medical qualifications, was arrested for producing and selling counterfeit medicines, but the procuratorate arrested him and charged him with fraud. He was prosecuted and the court sentenced him to 14 years in prison for fraud.

;

;Is Hou Yuanxiang possibly suspected of fraud? A reporter from Southern Weekend asked Hou Yuanxiang's first-instance lawyer about this. After a few seconds of silence, the lawyer asked: Fraud? Isn't that heavier? Later, he said that Hou Yuanxiang was "unlikely" to commit fraud.

;

;Another first-instance attorney for Hou Yuanxiang believed that Hou Yuanxiang committed the crime of "obstructing drug administration." This crime was newly established by the Eleventh Amendment to the Criminal Law promulgated in 2020. It refers to the criminal act of producing and selling drugs that have not obtained batch numbers but have not been identified as counterfeit drugs. This crime is stricter than the crime of "producing and selling counterfeit drugs". light.

;

;The lawyer did not accept an interview with Southern Weekend reporters, but said this: "If his (Hou Yuanxiang) family is found not guilty, then we can all do anything in the name of traditional Chinese medicine. ."

;

;While Hou Yuanxiang was under investigation, a large number of self-media videos of him "crying out his injustice" appeared on the Internet. Nong Jian Illustrations

;

;A lawyer representing Hou Yuanxiang in the second trial admitted to Southern Weekend reporters that for Hou Yuanxiang, who was severely sentenced in the first trial, the second trial was a "last-ditch fight." "The media played a big role" in the second instance of the case being sent back for retrial. (For detailed reports on Hou Yuanxiang’s case, please see ;"Pretending to be an expert and practicing medicine for ten years, relying on secret recipes to make homemade anti-cancer drugs: the crime and punishment of an unlicensed "miracle doctor"" ;)

;

;The media mentioned by the lawyer refers to online self-media. In fact, mainstream media outlets reported on the Hou Yuanxiang counterfeit drug case only after the second-instance ruling remanded the case for retrial.

;

;With the help of self-media, Hou Yuanxiang, who was originally unknown, was described as a "miraculous cancer doctor" who was wrongly convicted.

;

;"A woman with a public security background"

;

;In mid-March 2023, more than a month after the first-instance verdict of Hou Yuanxiang's counterfeit drug case, an article titled "Nine-year-old Xinxin asks for help: Mom The article "Treat more than 3,000 cancer patients but was sentenced to 11 years in prison and fined 30 million yuan" began to spread on the Internet. The article stated that Hou Yuanxiang’s daughter Hou Jing cured many difficult and complicated diseases using secret recipes of traditional Chinese medicine passed down from her ancestors. However, the traditional Chinese medicine liquid she prepared was deemed as fake medicine by the Qingdao Municipal Supervision Bureau “without any basis”. Hou Jing was sentenced to 11 years in the first trial. , the whole family is implicated. The article also attached a photo of Hou Jing's 9-year-old son asking for help: "Mom, why are you guilty of treating illnesses and saving people? Let netizens across the country comment for you..."

;

;This article sparked heated discussions among netizens. Southern Weekend reporters noticed that this article emphasized that Hou Jing graduated from a university of traditional Chinese medicine and was a herbalist, but avoided mentioning that Hou Jing did not have a medical certificate.

;

;Li Jianying, Hou Yuanxiang’s daughter-in-law, told Southern Weekend reporters that after the first-instance verdict, Hou Yuanxiang wanted to use the Internet to “cry out injustice.” At that time, she asked for photos of her children. She was worried that the children would be affected, so she did not give them. Only later did I use a photo of Hou Jing’s son.

;

;At the end of June 2023, self-media person Wu Pengfei began to intervene in Hou Yuanxiang’s fake drug case. Wu Pengfei calls himself an "old journalist" and a "well-known Internet writer" and has accounts on Douyin, Kuaishou, Toutiao and other platforms. Southern Weekend reporters found out that Wu Pengfei worked for a media in Hubei Province in his early years and established a planning and marketing company after leaving the media. When he started to get involved in Hou Yuanxiang's counterfeit drug case, Wu Pengfei exposed a big news: a woman with a public security background once offered 10 million to buy Hou Yuanxiang's secret treatment recipe. After being rejected, she threatened to make Hou Yuanxiang's family wait. Go to jail.

;

;Many self-media bloggers quoted Wu Pengfei's above statement, so that "a woman with a public security background cannot report Hou Yuanxiang by forcefully buying prescriptions" has become the mainstream online public opinion on Hou Yuanxiang's fake drug case.

;

;However, Li Gang, Hou Yuanxiang’s second-instance attorney, told Southern Weekend reporters that although he heard Hou Yuanxiang talk about the matter, he did not see relevant evidence, and Hou Yuanxiang did not report to the judicial authorities that someone was blackmailing him. Accusation. As a lawyer, he had "no comment" on this claim.

;

;Hou Yuanxiang’s first-instance attorney Yang Zining also told Southern Weekend reporters that the above statement “cannot be reflected in the (case) file.”

;

;Southern Weekend reporters noticed that during the 2020 COVID-19 epidemic, Wu Pengfei once praised another "miracle doctor" - Li Yuehua, an unlicensed doctor who claimed that phenol injection can cure COVID-19, and also released news that Li Yuehua He was invited by South Korea to fight the epidemic, but the news was denied by South Korean officials. Li Yuehua himself also told the media that he did not know about it.

;

;Southern Weekend reporters tried to contact Wu Pengfei, but as of press time, the other party had not responded.

;

;"How reliable are private investigations?"

;

;After publishing the above article, Wu Pengfei continued to publish short videos titled "Unjust Cases of Private Traditional Chinese Medicine" on multiple platforms. Now The 100th episode has been broadcast, and the number of views on the Douyin platform alone has exceeded 16 million. In these short videos, Wu Pengfei calls Hou Yuanxiang "Mr. Hou", saying that he is "the first person to treat cancer with traditional Chinese medicine", has "unique medical skills" and "amazing curative effects", "can be called a national treasure", and "has many cancers in his body". Every hair on your head is gold."

;

;In addition, Wu Pengfei also cited a set of data to show that Hou Yuanxiang is a "miracle doctor in cancer treatment." He said that "a national non-governmental traditional Chinese medicine organization" conducted a survey on the efficacy of China's top ten famous traditional Chinese medicine doctors in treating cancer: "The first one is Hou Yuanxiang. At that time, it was confirmed that he cured 1,166 cancer patients. The second senior traditional Chinese medicine doctor confirmed that he had cured 1,166 cancer patients." Only 11 people have been cured."

;

;Li Jianying also told Southern Weekend reporters that Hou Yuanxiang "cured" 1,166 cancer patients. "He (Hou Yuanxiang) has records," she said.

;

;However, Wu Pengfei did not say which organization the "national non-governmental organization of traditional Chinese medicine" is. In fact, even Li Gang had doubts about the data mentioned by Wu Pengfei: "How reliable are private surveys?"

;

;In another short video, Wu Pengfei said that Hou Yuanxiang cured more than 3,000 cancer patients patient. In the personal introduction of the "Yangdi Health" website (a website that claims to provide communication, display, and promotion services for "folk doctors"), Hou Yuanxiang has "cured more than 20,000 cancers."

;

;Some self-media have also questioned Hou Yuanxiang, but the number of clicks is not the same as Wu Pengfei’s short video. The self-media "Chinese Medicine Doctor Chen Lei" posted a video, calling Hou Yuanxiang a "liar who manufactures and sells fake medicines" and called on the public to view the case calmly: "If you ignore the facts, you are not loving Chinese medicine, you are harming Chinese medicine.";

;After the video was released, "Chen Lei, a Chinese medicine doctor" was immediately besieged by many supporters of Hou Yuanxiang on the Internet. Wu Pengfei even posted 8 short videos to refute the video. It didn’t take long for the video of “Chinese Medicine Doctor Chen Lei” to be removed from the shelves.

;

;After seeing Hou Yuanxiang’s counterfeit medicine case online, Qian Hui, general manager of Nanjing Guishitang Traditional Chinese Medicine Clinic, decided to express support. Qian Hui once had a similar experience to Hou Yuanxiang. According to media reports, Qian Hui does not have a medical license. In order to avoid "illegal medical practice", his traditional Chinese medicine clinic hires regular doctors to prescribe prescriptions for patients, while Qian Hui will "guide" on the side. The medicines prescribed by the doctors are all Guishitang. Homemade medicine based on our own "secret recipe".

;

;At the end of 2017, Guishitang was reported. Because it did not obtain a batch number, its self-made medicine was deemed to be counterfeit by the Nanjing Food and Drug Administration. Qian Hui and many employees of Guishitang were suspected of "producing and selling fake drugs." He was once criminally detained by the police for "drug crimes", among which Qian Hui was imprisoned for 28 days.

;

;"Why do we support Hou Yuanxiang's innocence? The main reason is from the perspective of protecting traditional Chinese medicine, because once Hou Yuanxiang's case is found guilty, many traditional Chinese medicine practitioners will no longer be able to practice." Qian Hui Speaking to Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;In the view of Gong Feiyun, one of the "partners" of Guishitang, traditional Chinese medicine is "folk Chinese medicine", and Hou Yuanxiang is one of many "folk Chinese medicine". He defines "folk traditional Chinese medicine" as follows: a general term for traditional Chinese medicine outside the system, which has not received formal education in traditional Chinese medicine at a university and does not have a physician's license.

;

;At the end of June 2013, Gong Feiyun went to Qingdao to meet Hou Yuanxiang. According to Gong Feiyun, although Hou Yuanxiang was under "residential surveillance" by the police at the time, the control was not strict at the time. He tried to find a way to invite him out and took a video.

;

;"Folk University of Traditional Chinese Medicine"

;

;Gong Feiyun also participated in the mediation of the Guishitang counterfeit drug case. According to him, during the handling of the case, Guishitang engaged in a "war of public opinion" with the Nanjing police: first, a Nanjing media exposed the case from the police's standpoint, and then Gong Feiyun contacted a foreign media and issued a notice about Guishitang. the sound of.

;

;In the end, the case stayed at the public security investigation stage and failed to enter the procuratorate for review and prosecution. After this disaster, Guishitang has since focused on the Shanghai market.

;

;Before Qian Hui and Gong Feiyun, another "folk Chinese medicine" supporter Guan Yue also supported Hou Yuanxiang online.

;

;Guan Yue calls himself "the first president of a folk university of traditional Chinese medicine", "a figure engraved on the Great Wall" and "president of the World Federation of Traditional Chinese Medicine Halls". He described the "Folk University of Traditional Chinese Medicine" as the "Whampoa Military Academy" of folk TCM. However, this university announced its establishment three years ago, but has not yet been established. Guan Yue once said publicly that after the establishment of this university, it will select "folk traditional Chinese medicine practitioners", "folk traditional Chinese medicine doctors" and "folk traditional Chinese medicine professors".

;

;Relevant information shows that in June 2020, as soon as the slogan of establishing a "private university of traditional Chinese medicine" was shouted, the band announced that it would hold an founding meeting of a branch of the university. The day after the conference, Guan Yue posted an advertisement for a medical training class in multiple Chinese medicine groups, claiming that people without any medical foundation could learn it on the spot, and the training fee was 18,000 yuan for two days (discounts available). Unexpectedly, this move and the "private university of traditional Chinese medicine" were publicly questioned by Gu Jingyu, a doctor from a tertiary hospital in Jiangsu. Guan Le responded: "The private university of traditional Chinese medicine" is an innovation: "Since it is an innovation, there must be no certificate. Since Without a certificate, it is definitely illegal..."

;

;After going to Qingdao to meet Hou Yuanxiang, Gong Feiyun and Guan Yue met in Shanghai. The two also visited a professor at East China University of Political Science and Law who supports folk traditional Chinese medicine. , and asked him to speak out on the Hou Yuanxiang case.

;

;On September 9, 2023, the second preparatory meeting for the establishment of a private university of traditional Chinese medicine planned by Guan Yue was held in Beijing. Qian Hui, Gong Yunfei, and Wei Baixing, who had spoken out on the Hou Yuanxiang case, all participated in this meeting. During the meeting, the Hou Yuanxiang case was discussed specifically.

;

;“(Hou Yuanxiang’s case) is equivalent to uniting all folk Chinese medicine practitioners.” Gong Feiyun told Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;After the second-instance ruling in Hou Yuanxiang’s counterfeit drug case was remanded for retrial, Hou Yuanxiang’s supporters were jubilant and posted “good news” online one after another, believing that there had been a “major turnaround” in the case.

;

;Shortly thereafter, another piece of news was revealed by self-media - Hou Yuanxiang was on a hunger strike, and the news was "absolutely true."

;

;However, Wu Pengfei quickly sent a short video to clarify, saying that Hou Yuanxiang was unable to eat because of his physical weakness. His apprentice "deliberately released news of the hunger strike because he was afraid that someone would assassinate Mr. Hou in order to attract the attention of the whole society." ".

;

;A few days later, Wu Pengfei posted another short video, saying that "Mr. Hou" had recovered and started "drinking a little wine" with every meal, while the police officer guarding him could only cook noodles for three meals a day... …

;

;According to the second-instance lawyer Li Gang, after the second-instance remand for retrial, the police changed Hou Yuanxiang’s place of residential surveillance because “too many people knew (Hou Yuanxiang’s original place of residential surveillance).”

;

;"I am no longer involved in this matter"

;

;Li Cheng (pseudonym) is the grandson of Hou Yuanxiang, a cancer patient from Jilin. He claims to be "ignorant" of many things. Under such circumstances, he also participated in the public opinion war to "cry out injustice" for Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;On June 8, 2022, after Hou Yuanxiang filed an appeal, a person named "Meteor and Sunset" on WeChat added Li Cheng's WeChat account, claiming to be the daughter-in-law of "Professor Hou".

;

;"Can you write a joint letter to Professor Hou to ask for mercy?"

;

;"What happened to Professor Hou?"

;

;"I was reported by others. , Now he is being treated in the hospital and cannot take his own medicine."

;

;Li Cheng then learned that Hou Yuanxiang was in trouble, and he told "Meteor and Sunset" that he could write a joint letter for Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;Two months later, "Meteor and Sunset" pulled Li Cheng into a WeChat group of cancer patients supporting Hou Yuanxiang.

;

;Li Cheng has a number labeled "Director Li's Anti-Cancer" stored in his mobile phone. This number was given to him by Hou Yuanxiang. When he bought medicine for his grandfather, he contacted this "Director Li".

;

;Before receiving a call from a reporter from Southern Weekend, Li Cheng had always thought that "Director Li" was called "Li Jianying" and that he was the person in charge of pharmaceuticals in the hospital where Hou Yuanxiang worked.

;

;But in fact, "Director Li" is Hou Yuanxiang's son Hou Lei, and "Meteor and Sunset" is Li Jianying. She is also the only adult in the Hou family who is not involved in the case.

;

;According to the first-instance judgment, in Hou Yuanxiang’s case, Hou Yuanxiang was known as “Professor Hou” and was responsible for providing formulas, diagnosing and treating cancer diseases, and selling medicines. His daughter Hou Jing was responsible for diagnosing and treating diseases other than cancer, selling medicines, and purchasing medicines. Chinese herbal medicines, brewing Chinese medicines, etc., while his son Hou Lei pretended to be "Director Li", the doctor in charge of taking and withdrawing medicines in the background, that is, Li Jianying.

;

;More than a month after adding "Meteor and Sunset" on WeChat, Li Cheng and Hou Yuanxiang also got in touch. "He (Hou Yuanxiang) said to put my information online, and I said yes, as long as it is helpful to your case." Li Cheng said.

;

;Li Cheng also suggested that Hou Yuanxiang talk about this matter on the self-media platform to increase attention. "He said yes, I will let my family do it."

;

;Later, Hou Yuanxiang sent some case materials to Li Cheng and asked him to help contact the media. Nothing was heard from him since. Li Cheng also failed to help Hou Yuanxiang contact the media. Until late July 2023, he sent a message to Hou Yuanxiang, "He replied to me and said that the (second trial) trial was about to start and the problem was not big." This was the last time Li Cheng contacted Hou Yuanxiang. Prior to this, the Hou family proposed to put Li Cheng's personal information online as one of Hou Yuanxiang's cases of "curing" cancer patients, and he agreed. However, before the list was posted online, Li Cheng's grandfather passed away.

;

;After learning the truth, Li Cheng realized that the matter was "not that simple" - "I didn't know any of this, I didn't know at all. I was just a patient's family member, thinking if I could help If you want, please help, but the prerequisite must be within the framework of the law...I will no longer be involved in this matter."

;

;Same-sex sexual behavior cannot directly produce offspring, and has long been regarded as a paradox of Darwinian evolution. . Because according to general understanding, in nature where natural selection and survival of the fittest occur, same-sex sexual behavior consumes precious energy and time but fails to produce offspring. Such behavior should have been eliminated in evolution, but the reality is that same-sex sexual behavior is still in the process of evolution. There is no shortage of them in nature and human society.

;

;Scientists have discovered same-sex behavior in more than 1,500 species of animals. Such behavior is not affected by gender and can occur between two males or two females. It appears in artificial breeding environments and also in the wild. It is not an accidental behavior forced by extreme environments. This also poses a difficult problem for scientists to understand its evolutionary logic.

;

;In October 2023, researchers from the University of Granada in Spain and other institutions tried to verify some relevant explanatory hypotheses through germline analysis of a large number of mammal same-sex sexual behavior information. Their latest research, published in Nature Communications, suggests that the evolution of same-sex sexual behavior is likely an adaptation to nature.

;

;Maintaining same-sex social relationships

;

;“Same-sex sexual behavior occurs in many mammalian species, including our relatives the great apes. Rather than classifying it as maladaptive or abnormal behavior, our study shows that this sexual behavior in mammals is a convergent adaptation that helps maintain social relationships and reduce same-sex conflicts." Lead author of the latest study, while at the Spanish Arid Zone Experimental Station Function and Evolution José M. Gómez, a professor at the Department of Ecology and the University of Granada, told Southern Weekend reporters that although same-sex sexual behavior occurs in many species, it is especially common among primates. This may Precisely because primates are more social than many other groups of mammals.

;

;From a data point of view, research has found same-sex sexual behavior in more than 260 species of mammals. In more than 80% of the cases, it takes the form of back crawling or genital contact, and less than 30% Some species even display same-sex behavior through courtship or pairing. Judging from the age, same-sex sexual behavior mainly occurs in adult mammals, and young same-sex sexual behavior is only found in 10 species of animals. From an environmental perspective, more than 80% of the samples had same-sex sexual behavior occurring in wild or semi-wild environments. In terms of gender, same-sex behavior is relatively evenly distributed among mammals. Female same-sex behavior has been recorded in more than 160 species, and male same-sex behavior has been found in more than 190 species. Combined, about half of all species have same-sex behavior. Homosexuality involving two genders at the same time.

;

;It is worth noting that the latest study is only based on existing records of same-sex sexual behavior in mammals and does not represent the entire situation of mammals. In fact, because the discovery of same-sex sexual behavior in nature relies on observation, and in some species females and males look very similar, and it is even difficult to distinguish between male and female. Some scientists estimate that the current records of same-sex sexual behavior in nature should be underestimated. Moreover, compared with mammals, birds, reptiles, fish, insects and other invertebrates are either small in size or live far away from the ground, making observation difficult, but they have all recorded same-sex sexual behavior. Therefore, patterns of same-sex sexual behavior in nature are far more complex than what has been observed in mammals.

;

;Previously, many hypotheses interpreted same-sex sexual behavior as maladaptive or abnormal behavior, speculating that this behavior may be a manifestation of specific conditions such as incorrect gender identity, lack of opposite-sex peers, or frustration with opposite-sex sexual behavior. From the perspective of sexual behavior scenarios, the latest research has found that same-sex sexual behavior does not necessarily require extremely special occasions. Although same-sex sexual behavior is rare in some species and can only be observed in very special circumstances, for about 40% of the mammals studied, same-sex sexual behavior can be regarded as moderate to high frequency activity during a specific period of time, and during mating Seasons are easy to observe.

;

;Same-sex and opposite-sex coexist

;

;And some behavioral observations have long shown that same-sex sexual behavior may play a positive role in some populations. For example, some same-sex behavior among male bottlenose dolphins may help strengthen alliances among small groups, and same-sex behavior among female bonobo groups may promote reconciliation among members. However, the latest study's germline analysis does not focus on the mechanisms of same-sex sexual behavior in specific species, but uses large-scale statistics to link same-sex sexual behavior to social behavior. This research shows that same-sex sexual behavior is similar to many other behavioral traits that have evolved through natural selection.

;

;Professor Jose Gomez reminded that the meaning of same-sex sexual behavior here should be understood within the framework of evolutionary biology, which is still different from the current human society’s views on gender and other related issues. Because in the study of evolutionary biology, same-sex sexual behavior is a temporary behavior of individuals in a certain period of time, not a permanent behavior or life choice. They may also have heterosexual sexual behavior at the same time. Therefore, it cannot be directly related to human society. behavior analogy.

;

;In human society, issues related to same-sex sexual behavior are rooted in different cultural environments and historical traditions in different places, and are more complicated to understand. But in recent years, the discussion of distinguishing human same-sex sexual behavior has also attracted the attention of scientists. The core concern is to what extent people who have had same-sex sexual behavior can be defined as homosexual.

;

;In 2019, researchers from Harvard University and other institutions published a large-scale genetic study in Science magazine, trying to reveal the genetic characteristics of same-sex sexual behavior, which is the so-called "homosexuality" Gene". Through collaboration with the British Biobank and genetic testing analysis company 23andMe, researchers finally identified multiple genetic loci related to same-sex sexual behavior from hundreds of thousands of genetic samples, indicating that the "gay gene" is similar to other behavioral characteristics. It is also polygenic.

;

;But in 2021, scientists from sex and gender research institutions such as Indiana University’s Kinsey Institute publicly expressed opposition to this research, believing that it only distinguishes people by whether they have had same-sex sexual intercourse. It conflates heterosexuality, bisexuality, and homosexuality, and does not accurately measure people's sexual behavior, sexual attraction, and sexual identity. Therefore, the genetic characteristics ultimately discovered may not reveal the tendency to have same-sex sexual behavior, but only reveal the preferences. The personality trait of pursuing novelty.

;

;Because in the view of sexology researchers, heterosexuality should be a continuous pattern of sexual attraction. Just because a person has had same-sex sexual behavior does not mean that he is not heterosexual. Alfred Kinsey, the pioneer of sexology research, developed a scale very early to distinguish people who have had same-sex sexual behavior. According to the frequency of same-sex sexual behavior, people can be divided into multiple types, rather than Either gay or straight.

;

;It may help reproduction

;

;The controversy in human society about how to distinguish same-sex sexual behavior from homosexuality also reflects a difficulty in understanding the logic of evolution to a certain extent. Compared with human society, which highly binds concepts such as "same-sex sexual behavior", "homosexuality" and "no offspring", same-sex sexual behavior may never mean "no offspring" in the long evolutionary history.

;

;"Darwin's paradox of evolution should be put aside; it no longer exists because the existence of bisexual behavior in various animal species ensures that same-sex behavior does not hinder reproductive success." Empire Vincent Savolainen, a professor at the Department of Life Sciences of the Polytechnic Institute of Technology, told Southern Weekend reporters that there are many concepts surrounding same-sex sexual behavior, but from a biological perspective, same-sex sexual behavior may be the same as homosexuality, bisexuality, etc. There are some similar mechanisms and evolutionary logic, which biologists can continue to study in the future. At the same time, psychologists can also delve into other aspects of this complex behavior, such as sexual preferences, to better understand the evolution of same-sex behavior.

;

;From a historical perspective on same-sex sexual behavior, the key reason why evolutionary logic is difficult to understand is that it is speculated that its adaptation cost is too high and the cost of behavior is too high. However, including the latest research, many studies in recent years have shown that same-sex sexual behavior does not mean "no offspring" in the evolutionary process, but may have a positive impact on the reproduction of offspring in other indirect ways.

;

; In 2021, the scientist Brendan Zietsch, a scientist at the University of Queensland, Australia, used hundreds of thousands of samples of genetic data to simulate human evolution, which also contains a lot of heterosexuality Data from partner. Analysis shows that among people with heterosexual behaviors, genetic genes related to homosexual behavior can at the same time allow people to have more heterosexual partners, which means that they have obtained sexual mating advantages.

;

; Further analysis shows that behind this is also related to the characteristics of openness and adventure. People with more open personality will be more willing to try new things, and have stronger curiosity and imagination. Researchers speculate that genetically -related genes related to the tendency of homosexual behavior also give people related personality traits, which makes people with related genetic genes more advantageous in finding heterosexual partners.

;

; As a result, although homosexual behavior itself does not produce offspring, related genes can allow people to gain the advantages of fertility offspring, which leads to homosexual behavior to this day. However, Brundan Ziqi emphasized that although this study has the advantages of data, the relevant interpretation is still exploratory, and more research needs to understand the performance related to homosexual behavior to understand The foundation of its evolution.

;

; The hereditary of the long -term primary

;

; Professor Vincent Savolina has also carried out research on homosexual behavior, and obtained the conclusion of similar support for fertility advantages . In August 2023, through analysis of the three years of observation of data from the Ganges monkey, they found that homosexual behaviors in the Ganges monkey community were common, and they were basically not affected by age or community structure. What adaptability, instead, the same sexual behavior regulates the relationship between companions and improves the success rate of reproduction.

;

; Related research published in "Nature Ecology & Amp; Evolution", which observed the social and sexual behavior of more than 200 male Ganges monkeys. Combined with the bloodline data of decades ago, studies have shown that the same sexual behavior in the male Ganges monkeys is both duplicate and hereditary, with a genetic rate of 6.4%. The first evidence that can be inherited.

;

; "Ganges monkey shared more than 70%of DNA with humans, tracing back to about 25 million years ago, and we also have a common ancestor with us. They are the main non -human long categories used in biomedical research. Animals are also an excellent model of ecological problems such as homosexual behavior. However, it is worth noting that there are still differences between the Ganges monkey and humans. We hope to study these intricate mysteries and find it. Our common behavior of evolutionary history. "Professor Vincent Savarinen explained to the reporter from the south weekend that the latest research shows that homosexual behavior may be a common feature of the long -awaited ecology of spiritual long animals. Simplic behavior is inspired, but due to some unique social factors in human society, homosexual behavior in human society does have a great price.

;

; "Humanity seems to be the only species that shows strict homosexuality." Professor Vincent Savolina said that cultural factors will affect this phenomenon. For example, in Samoa, although some gays have no descendants, they actually assume the role of women in the society and help children who support relatives. "I hope that our research can play a role in cultivating more tolerance culture, and to inclusive gender diversity in nature and human society."
